review: I like the concept, and when it works, it's very nice and also tiny. But its Wi-Fi issues out in our kitchen made me swap it out for my old Roku, which never seems to lose the signal like the Chromecast always did.We have only one other HD TV in the house (in the living room), and that's a SmartTV, so we don't need something like a Chromecast there. I haven't found a way to get it to work on an older CRT TV, though I suppose I could buy some sort of adapter to get it to work. But then it'll start to get as pricey as just getting another Roku, which I *know* works well anywhere in the house.
